STest.name: STest

Testable.name: Testable

TestItem.name: TestItem
TestItem.description:
An object that knows the name of a function and a result, generated by that function, to be tested. It also contains the logic for a series of tests.
It is expected to be given a result from a Testable object and to run one or more of its tests on it. Reporting is printed to the console;
The last function called needs to be endTests() which will pass through the result, even if the test(s) failed.
If a test is called within a looping function, the number of tests run can be reduced by adding an iteration limit.
This will stop the test results printing after that limit, but won't stop the function executing.
The iteration limit is added as the last parameter to the test function.

params.name: resultToTest
params.description: the value that has been generated by some function which is being tested against an expected value

params.name: testingOn
params.description: true if tests are to be run, false if not

classitems.description: Each Testable object keeps a collection of TestItems, where the key is the name of the function and the value is the TestItem. This is only for internal use by Testable
classitems.name: testItems

classitems.description: Set to false to turn testing off for all functions in the Testable object.
classitems.name: testingOn

classitems.description: Wraps a function so that it runs and can have its result tested
classitems.name: addFunction

return.description: A TestItem that contains the function

classitems.description:
This is used by addFunction to register TestItems in the testItems collection
and associate the result being tested with it. (If the TestItem has previously been added to testItems, it is not added twice)
classitems.name: registerTestItem

params.name: The
params.description: value returned by the function that is to be tested

return.description: The TestItem, now registered and with the resultToTest associated with it

classitems.description: Used for turning tests on or off
classitems.name: setTestingOn

params.name: testingOn
params.description: Set to true to turn testing on or false to turn testing off

params.name: functionName
params.description: [optional] If given this turns testing on/off for just the given function, otherwise all functions will have their testing turned on/off TODO currently not working

classitems.description: Print out a description of the test(s)
classitems.name: describe

return.description: This TestItem (to be passed to other tests)

classitems.description:
An object that contains functions which are the individual tests that are to be run, in turn, by the expect() function
Any new tests needed should be coded in here.
Note that the name 'iterationLimit' is a special name and should not be varied

See the Attributes section for a listing of all the tests
classitems.name: tests

classitems.description: Logs a PASS if the result being tested returns anything that is not null or an empty string, Logs a FAIL if not
classitems.name: something

classitems.description: Logs a PASS if the result being tested returns true, Logs a FAIL if not
classitems.name: true

classitems.description: Logs a PASS  if the result being tested returns false, Logs a FAIL if not
classitems.name: false

classitems.description: Logs a PASS  if the result being tested equals the expected value (the 2nd parameter), Logs a FAIL if not
classitems.name: toBe

classitems.description: Logs a PASS  if the result being tested is an object of the expected type (the 2nd parameter), Logs a FAIL if not
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
Logs a PASS if the result being tested is an HTMLElement.
If a 2nd parameter is given specifying the particular element then a PASS will be given only if the result is exactly that type.
Logs a FAIL otherwise
classitems.name: htmlElement

classitems.description:
Logs a PASS if the String being tested contains the String given as the 2nd parameter.
Logs a FAIL otherwise
classitems.name: contains

classitems.description:
Logs a PASS if the String being tested contains the String given as the 2nd parameter.
Logs a FAIL otherwise
classitems.name: contains

classitems.description: The function that runs the test of the given name and prints the result to the console
classitems.name: expect

params.name: expectedValue
params.description: [optional - needed for some tests but not others] The expected value to test the actual value against

params.name: iterationLimit
params.description: [optional] The maximum number of times to run this particular test. Once over the maximum the test won't be run. If not given, then the maximum is infinite.

return.description: This TestItem (to be passed to other tests)

classitems.description: Finds the current iteration limit for the current test
classitems.name: getIterationLimit

return.description: The iteration limit (an integer) - can be undefined if no iteration limit was given

classitems.description: Simply prints the actual value (the value being tested) to the console
classitems.name: printActual

return.description: This TestItem (to be passed to other tests)

classitems.description: Prints the given message to the console if testing is turned On
classitems.name: log

classitems.description: The beginning of the line printed when a test passes
classitems.name: passString

classitems.description: The beginning of the line printed when a testfails
classitems.name: failString

classitems.description: The beginning of the line printed when there is an error attempting to run a test
classitems.name: errorString

classitems.description: This method should be called at the end of a chain of tests to return the value that was being tested, just as if the function was called without any tests attached
classitems.name: endTests

return.description: the original value, returned by the function, that has been tested

classitems.description:
Checks to see whether the current number of iterations is less than the iterationLimit
return true if it is, false if we have reached the iterationLimit
or if no iterationLimit is given, return true, as any number of iterations is OK
classitems.name: checkIterations

params.name: iterationLimit
params.description: The max number of iterations allowed for running the current test

return.description: false if the iteration limit has been reached, true if not

classitems.description: Resets the iteration number of the given test to 0. Or if there is no testName given, reset all iteration numbers for all tests
classitems.name: resetIterations

params.name: optional
params.description: testName The test for which to reset the iterations
